questiontext.text:
Exercise

Calculate the centre of mass of the 4 masses distributed as shown below

Give your answer as a rational number (fraction)

\(\bar{x}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
\(\bar{x}=\dfrac{(9)(-1)+(1)(2)+(5)(6)+(2)(8)}{9+1+5+2}=\dfrac{39}{17}\).

The centre of mass is located a distance \(\frac{39}{17} \approx 2.29\) units along the \(x\)-axis from \(O\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
